title: Finalists picked for best bathrooms in Canada | Canada | Travel | Toronto Sun
text:
If you can hold it, we can tell you the five best places to take care of your business across Canada. And they're pretty swank.
Website bestrestroom.com has released its top-5 finalists in the 2015 Cintas Canada's Best Restroom contest.
Four of the public johns are in restaurants or hotels -- and three of those in Alberta alone.
One, however, is in a duty-free shop on the border of Ontario and New York State.
"Travellers leaving Canada and heading back to the United States often make this washroom their last stop before crossing the border," the review says. "(It) gives customers a 'swell farewell' with their clean and inviting restroom that's incredibly well designed."
The washroom features rounded vessel sinks on marble counters, dark wood and stained glass cubicle doors, and sleek hanging lights.
Another bathroom at the Edmonton Renaissance Airport Hotel features black-tiled walls, marble sinks, full-length mirrors and personal vanity mirrors, with a red couch in the shape of lips.
"This one-of-a-kind washroom has the in-style traveller in mind, and will leave you feeling refreshed and pampered," the site says.
People can votes for their favourite on the website. Votes will be compiled until Oct. 9, when a winner will be announced.
--- --- ---
Finalists:
Bank & Baron P.U.B., Calgary
Edmonton Renaissance Airport Hotel, Edmonton
1000 Islands Duty Free, Lansdowne, Ont.
The Tommyfield Gastro Pub, Calgary
BNA Brewing Company & Eatery, Kelowna, B.C.
